title: Composite accumulation function with graph part - c

content.description:
Let f be a function whose domain is the closed interval[0,5] . The graph of f is shown above.

Let <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <munderover> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </munderover> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@45E7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
content.question: At what x is <math> <mrow> <mi> h </mi> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mi> x </mi> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> a minimum? Show the analysis that leads to your conclusion.
